title: ICE with conservative_impl_trait

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: A-impl-trait
labels.description: Area: impl Trait. Universally / existentially quantified anonymous types with static dispatch.

body:
```
rustc 1.23.0-nightly (8b22e70b2 2017-10-31)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: 8b22e70b2de5152db3b0c53cfa16eb96b0b9e40e
commit-date: 2017-10-31
host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu
release: 1.23.0-nightly
LLVM version: 4.0
```

[Somewhat minimal example.](https://play.rust-lang.org/?gist=cf167fab8cc9cb50d2b0a6646eca31ad&version=nightly)

Interestingly enough the error I'm getting in the actual project where I stumbled upon this is slightly different, here's a backtrace of that:
```
error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic

note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug.

note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#bug-reports
```
